text: Don't know if this is the answer, but did you try removing the ".."?
Or remove a only one point "./YourURL"
I have tried both options and it doesn't work. The only thing that seems to work is making it a absolute path, with the actually theme file mentioned

Hey Darla, is the html file you're working on contained in a folder in the same directory (or folder) as the modules folder?

EX. Is it contained in theme_name/templates/this_file or is it contained in theme_name/templates/another_folder/this_file

If it's the former I'd recommend submitting a support ticket as that looks incorrect, if it's the latter, I'd try adding an additional ../

So you'd have `../../modules/impressa-footer-copyright.module`

 More on this here <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/building-blocks/modules/using-modules-in-templates#basic-module-syntax>
<@U01AS49TB0T> Thanks Maxwell! I ended up getting this solution on the developer forum, but thank you for reponding!
